name: My Kid's Favorite Zucchini Bread
author: Lynnsthings
summary: This recipe is delicious, moist and a great way to use up all the zucchini that your garden produces. Enjoy! Shred the zucchini first and let it sit in a colander to drain while putting the other ingredients together. I use very large zucchini from my garden and cut out all the seeds. Use left over shredded zucchini to make fritters. Optional additions include pecans, walnuts, dried cherries, raisins, or chocolate chips.
directions: Preheat an oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Mix the whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, nutmeg, cinnamon, salt, baking soda, white sugar, and light brown sugar together in a large bowl
Fold the vanilla extract, eggs, vegetable oil, lemon juice, and zucchini into the flour mixture one ingredient at a time with a rubber spatula; divide the mixture between 2 loaf pans
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 65 to 75 minutes
Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack
